div.p: VPRS 927/P000/6, p. 163, International Exhibition 1866-7 outward letterbook, Correspondence relating to various exhibitions. VA 912 Trustees of Melborne Public Library &c, Public Record Office, Victoria.
Your idea about the […is] is excellent — I act on it.

Be so good as to send as closely approximate as possible Estimate of the space you require for yr timber & say where you propose to put it. It is high time to allot spaces & make provision for the placing of objects so as to prevent hurry & confusion at the last moment. — When the spots for location are fixed they can be defined with chalk lines & the Exhibitors can go to work themselves in arranging — I know not how you propose to arrange yr timber — It wod
would. present an effective appearance if piled up — Moreover it wod not then occupy a large area of floor, a most important consideration as I fear we shall find ourselves cramped
